VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has completed their Corrective Action Plan (CAP) from their 2023
Interim. The agency did not have any issues with their Human Resources (HR)
files. Previous interim had violations in the TB testing, references and criminal
assessment of an employee under R. 400.4113. This year, the agency hired a HR
staff that resolved these problems. Start date and hire dates were clearly shown so
that TB testing aligned with the rule. HR files all contained references as outlined
in the rules. One file was viewed this reporting period and criminal assessment
was completed. Much improvement was made in this domain over the year.
Financial Overview
There are no financial concerns identified based on the review of the facility's
financial audit in 2024.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
N/A
Chief Administrator Assessment
I reviewed the Chief Administrator Assessment. The agency had three unplanned
discharges where one youth truanted from campus, one youth was hospitalized,

and one was released earlier than expected. The agency meets at a clinical level
to discuss unplanned discharges as well as rule compliance and policy
compliance. The agency feels they have shown improvements in this area. Their
quality improvement team meets monthly and brings any concerns to
administrative meetings.
Staff and Youth Interviews
All staff reported a supportive culture. Staff verbalized treatment being completed
with youth. Staff reported they work well together.
All youth were dressed appropriately and respectful. All youth reported they are
involved in programs, and all were able to verbalize being involved in activities and
treatment, i.e therapy, school, recreational.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency is well maintained. The campus grounds are kept nice. Art projects
are on the walls in the school and new carpet has been placed in the boy's unit.
The girl's unit continues to be taken care of as well. No safety concerns were
identified.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes. It is recommended that the agency be issued a renewal of their regular
license.
